channel.title: Extremely odd problem... [474/PI]
channel.description: So I have my server hosted on a dedicated server, but my client connects to someone else's server. I've changed ALL the ip's in the client to my dedi, but it still connects to the other server. Any ideas on why this is happening?

item.title: Extremely odd problem... [474/PI]
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

This may just be a silly question, but have you checked your run.bat for an IP? Because some clients are setup like that. Unless you’re using an IDE.

Read full topic

@matzie wrote:

Was just a suggestion (:
In that case i think the name of your client should be “troll-client” lol. cuz it looks like its doing a good job :o

item.title: Extremely odd problem... [474/PI]
item.dc:creator: @Redemtion Redemtion
item.description:
@Redemtion wrote:

[quote=“Yesteryear, post:24, topic:519824”]1. Are you sure it’s not your server?
2. (Mind sound stupid.) Have you even compiled the client?[/quote]

  1. My server is RuneMyth, not ZexScape.
  2. Yes, many times.

Update:
A guy on Rune-Server tried to help me and still couldn’t even figure it out. There’s still no explanation why my client’s being like this. It connected to his server just fine, and the Dedi also has a minecraft server that used to be on it, and it worked fine as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Extremely odd problem... [474/PI]
item.dc:creator: @Redemtion Redemtion
item.description:
@Redemtion wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:20, topic:519824”]paste your run.bat, and look for the file it loads( java EGUI,GUI,client) one of the 3, then go to that file and search for “main(String args[])”
then look for “setServer(”
Your client could be loading its server from an outside source, (like the bat file) but

setServer or “server =”
are what you need to search for[/quote]

Its client .java but i already changed it.

Read full topic

item.title: Extremely odd problem... [474/PI]
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

paste your run.bat, and look for the file it loads( java EGUI,GUI,client) one of the 3, then go to that file and search for “main(String args[])”
then look for “setServer(”
Your client could be loading its server from an outside source, (like the bat file) but

setServer or “server =”
are what you need to search for

Read full topic

item.title: Extremely odd problem... [474/PI]
item.dc:creator: @Redemtion Redemtion
item.description:
@Redemtion wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:16, topic:519824”][quote author=xxxtilllyxxx link=topic=638318.msg4302384#msg4302384 date=1369197036]
All PI’s are based off 474.
[/quote]
474 is the client revision which has nothing to do with the server. You can make a 474 client compatible with a PI source. You’ll just need to do some edits.[/quote]

But why would my client connect to someone elses server?

Read full topic

All PI’s are based off 474.

474 is the client revision which has nothing to do with the server. You can make a 474 client compatible with a PI source. You’ll just need to do some edits.

item.title: Extremely odd problem... [474/PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I don’t see how you have a 474 PI but that’s aside my point
Most 317 clients have IP’s set via client.java not that I’ve seen any other. Not all, however, use the same structure to do so. I’ve seen one’s where they have the one string: “server = 127.0.0.1;” or ones with some obfuscated code like if(server = 127.0.0.1) do this etc. To eliminate all possible IP’s you’d have to go in line by line searching for possible IP addresses.
You could always change the port between your server and your client to something not 43594, and see what happens to the connection.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Redemtion wrote:

xxxtilllyxxx:

Your client obviously isn’t connecting to the IP. Unless somebody is using the same IP to host the server?

Which is extremely unlikely to have a server with the same ip… Cause we just got a new router for the dedi.

item.title: Extremely odd problem... [474/PI]
item.dc:creator: @Redemtion Redemtion
item.description:
@Redemtion wrote:

xxxtilllyxxx:

Your personal client needs to connect to localHost. And the client others are using will use the Dedi IP.

I shouldn’t need to, because I’m not hosting from my computer. Everyone that i gave the client to, to test it out connected to the same server my client connected to as well, for some reason. I have no idea why it does it.

Read full topic

item.title: Extremely odd problem... [474/PI]
item.dc:creator: @xxxtilllyxxx xxxtilllyxxx
item.description:
@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

Your personal client needs to connect to localHost. And the client others are using will use the Dedi IP.

Read full topic

item.title: Extremely odd problem... [474/PI]
item.dc:creator: @Redemtion Redemtion
item.description:
@Redemtion wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:4, topic:519824”][quote author=Redemtion link=topic=638318.msg4302313#msg4302313 date=1369187124]

So I have my server hosted on a dedicated server, but my client connects to someone else’s server. I’ve changed ALL the ip’s in the client to my dedi, but it still connects to the other server. Any ideas on why this is happening?

Are you using a no-ip?

No, we have a DDNS to our server, and I verified that it is to the server aswell. This is extremely confusing to me lol.
[/quote]
So you’re just using your VPS ip?[/quote]
Yes, I’ve also checked the coding and there’s no different ip inside it.

Read full topic
